meanings.definition: To pledge or pawn something as security for a loan or debt.
meanings.sent1: He impawns his watch to borrow money from the pawnshop.
meanings.sent2: She impawns her jewelry to get a loan for her business.
meanings.sent3: The man impawns his guitar to buy a ticket to the concert.
meanings.sent4: She impawns her phone to pay for her overdue bills.
meanings.sent5: He impawns his car to secure a loan for his new business venture.

meanings.definition: To put something at risk or in jeopardy.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked impawns the safety of the house.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a helmet while biking impawns your head's safety.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food before a meeting impawns your chances of a quiet stomach.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs impawns your health in the long run.
meanings.sent5: Speeding on the highway impawns your life and others' safety.
